title: Installing Perl on an older system
body:
I am trying to build various libraries on an older RHEL system. The problem is I can't even get Perl to build. 

I do 

```
spack build perl
```
and I get

```
./findhdr: line 14: /usr/local/bin/awk: Permission denied
<stdarg.h> NOT found
./findhdr: line 14: /usr/local/bin/awk: Permission denied
<varargs.h> NOT found, but that's ok (I hope).
*** WHOA THERE!!! ***
Your C compiler "cc" doesn't seem to support stdarg or varargs!
 I'm giving up; maybe you can try again with a different compiler?
```
This is on  RHEL, 2.6.32-696.el6.x86_64 with gcc 4.4.7.

So, it seems awk is a problem. But its only /usr/local/bin/awk that is a problem. I tried to do the following in compilers.yaml

```
environment:
  set:
     awk : /usr/bin/awk
```

which doesn't fix the issue since the problem is in the Configure stage. So how do I tell it to use this path for awk during the configure stage.
